text.text_translated:
In the last 200 years, health and technology improved.
Fewer children died young.
This caused the population to grow very fast.
Families were large.
Large families had even more children.
Many children lived to be adults.
Then they had their own children.
In the 1960s, contraception became more available.
Contraception is a way to stop having a baby.
After that, the world average number of babies fell.
It went from six per woman to as low as two.

best_attempt.text_translated: In the last two centuries, health and technology improved. Fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. Families were big. Big families had many children. Many children lived to be adults. Then they had children too. In the 1960s, more people could get contraception. Contraception is ways to stop a woman having a baby. After that, women had fewer babies on average. The world average fell from six to two babies per woman.
